Description: Unfinished / imperfect bead: consisting of a twisted thread of translucent pale-blue glass. At present mounted on a thin bronze wire, now badly corroded. Apparently these two pieces were not together originally.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Tell el Armana’ (London 1894), pl. XIII, 56.

The bead has a trail of glass at the top, which is from manufacture, where the glass-rod has not combined properly with the rest of the bead. The wire is part of the refuse from manufacturing (possibly not this of bead): The bead was produced by winding molten glass-rods around the wire, which must have either snapped off during manufacture or discarded alongside the imperfect bead during manufacture.
